cyclone.name: CINDY
cyclone.current_location: about 360 miles SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to move northwest, then north-northwest toward the Texas-Louisiana border and inland over southeast Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Sabine Pass / TX-LA border (southeast Texas)

weather_observation.warning_coast: San Luis Pass, TX eastward to the mouth of the Pearl River, LA (includes Sabine Pass/Beaumont area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from the central Texas coast to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (30–45 mph sustained with higher gusts) possible late Wednesday into Thursday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation above ground level possible along the upper Texas coast including Sabine Pass entrance.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with isolated amounts near 6 inches; risk of flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible as outer rain bands move onshore.
